revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Doris: A Nudibranchiate Mollusk
tldr: This article examines the anatomy and physiology of the Doris, a type of nudibranchiate mollusk. The authors provide a detailed description of the Doris' anatomy, including its digestive, nervous, and circulatory systems. They also discuss the development and structure of the Doris' spiny tongue and teeth, which play a crucial role in its feeding process. The study contributes to the understanding of the biology and evolution of these fascinating marine creatures.
